intro: Calyptranthera punctulata, commonly known as the spotted calyptranthera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture and produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pink. Its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences and bloom during the warm seasons. Calyptranthera punctulata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and shrublands.
